thread.title: Russia sees at least 100 civilians leaving eastern Ghouta on Thursday

title: Russia sees at least 100 civilians leaving eastern Ghouta on Thursday
text: March 15, 2018 / 7:50 AM / Updated 27 minutes ago Russia sees at least 100 civilians leaving eastern Ghouta on Thursday Reuters Staff 1 Min Read MOSCOW (Reuters) - Russia expects at least 100 civilians on Thursday to leave Syria’s eastern Ghouta area, where another ceasefire has been declared, Interfax news agency reported. Civilians are seen in a bus during evacuation from the besieged town of Douma, Eastern Ghouta, in Damascus, Syria March 13, 2018. REUTERS/Bassam Khabieh Citing the Centre for Reconciliation in Syria, a body run by Russia’s defense ministry, it also said eastern Ghouta would receive 137 tonnes of food as humanitarian aid. Reporting by Polina Devitt; Writing by Andrey Ostroukh; Editing by Gareth Jones
